page.title: 10The Toxic Legacy in Aldridge
page.content: Pollution is a problem of the 1980's, rivers, streams and open land are all becoming spoiled by dumping or tipping of waste. In the West Midlands are over 300 sites holding contaminated chemical waste. Reports were made up to 10 years ago of obnoxious waste being dumped in disused mine shafts or quarry workings. Long term effects of this hazardous waste disposal were not fully examined. In Aldridge the toxic waste dump was at the 'Mitco Lagoon' and was so full of unknown waste that officials were not prepared to take samples by boat. The smell and fumes caused were obnoxious, giving concern as a health hazard. Mitco Tip is no longer used as a tip and efforts have been made to fill it with solid material to restore the land to local community. The concern is can we escape the legacy of buried chemicals.
